snippet: World leaders expressed a growing outrage over pro-Russian rebels’ refusal to cede authority over the site where the downed jet’s debris is scattered.
abstract: Russian-backed rebels refuse to cede control of crash site three days after downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 in eastern Ukraine, with bodies of most victims remaining in refrigerated train cars; incoherent recovery effort is being carried out by groups of mostly untrained people, potentially compromising evidence and levying final indignity on mourning families; rebels and Ukrainian government have accused each other of complicity in disaster, creating environment of mistrust.

byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and NOAH SNEIDER
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Kiev, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: World leaders expressed a growing outrage over pro-Russian rebels’ refusal to cede authority over the site where the downed jet’s debris is scattered.

headline.main: Bodies From Malaysia Airlines Flight Are Stuck in Ukraine, Held Hostage Over Distrust
headline.print_headline: Victims’ Bodies Held Hostage Over Distrust
